column4: I'm having trouble setting up a network between two ubuntu boxes. I've set up the netmask, adderss and network variables in /etc/network/interfaces on both machines but am still unable to ping either machine from the other. Does anyone know what else I need to do?
first, try using a graphical tool instead of editing the interfaces file manually, you'll avoid syntax errors
then, are you sure the two machines are plugged in the good ethernet plug? ;)
that's only an option on one machine, the other only has a server install
finally, we can look a the conf :)
paste your two files (and name the machines) on the pastebin and give the url
I've just pasted my config on the pastebin http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/22867
1 sec, i'm looking at it
how are the two machines connected (physically)?
ok so direct connec, lemme check
what's your other machine configuration
(interfaces file)
should work then, are you sure it's a crossover cable?
yes, I've sucessfully used it to link windows machines in past
ok you didn't forget sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart
that's weird :) it should work; are you sure your ethernet cards are supported and functional?
no iptables firewall?
check if you don't have to put an exception for your lan
netsavy006 ok I know what to do for your prob, a sec :)
boy do I feel like an idiot now, I added an exception for the other box's IP but that didn't work, disableing the firewall however allowed the connection
hehe :) so problem solved, yeah
just incase you wanted to know, I've fixed up the firewall and now have everythnig working perfectly, thanks again for you help
